intro: Hyoscyamus purpureus, commonly known as the purple figwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, purple to violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and contains various alkaloids, some of which have medicinal properties. Hyoscyamus purpureus is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
